definition: fragrant/sweet smelling/aromatic/savory or appetizing/(to eat) with relish/(of sleep) sound/perfume or spice/joss or incense stick/CL:根[gen1]
to burn incense in prayer to a God

sentences.english: Light an aromatherapy candle or incense.
If you want to revisit and harmony, so apparently burning, sweeping the courtyard.
sentences.chinese: 如果想重溫祥和，就得淨手焚香，灑掃庭院。

sentences.english: Let's burn incense in the memory of our pure past.
sentences.chinese: 焚香紀念我們逝去的節操。

sentences.english: Put you held in the hand, pious incense.
sentences.chinese: 把你捧在手上，虔誠地焚香。

sentences.english: Her boyfriend fed a box of oxygen and hydrogen to the ox and fox.
sentences.chinese: 誅仙前傳焚香谷男朋友給牛和狐狸餵了一盒子氧和氫。

sentences.english: After lighting incense and chanting prayers, the magistrate had curtains erected around the bell.
sentences.chinese: 焚香誦經後，知縣用一塊布簾將鍾擋了起來。

sentences.english: Thou shalt make also an altar to burn incense, of setim wood.
sentences.chinese: 你應做焚香的壇，用皂莢木製造。

sentences.english: Reading Romance of the Western Bower, one must burn incense.
And oil to maintain lights, and to make ointment, and most sweet incense.
sentences.chinese: 燈油，爲制傅禮的油和焚香用的香料。

definition: to respect a deity/to pray to a God
to burn incense at a temple
